website_summaries.verdict: A top-selling brand that makes a variety of effective and affordable aquarium filters for tanks ranging in size from approximately 20 to 70 gallons.
pros: Three-stage filtration system with a reliable flow rate
Easy to set up, and comes at an affordable price
cons: Bio-wheel of the biological filtration stage has been known to stop turning

customer_reviews.title: Bio-wheel Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: Received this filter today very happy and excited to set up. The set up was a breeze and I got it to run pretty quick.with that said it didn't take long for the "bio-wheel" to start acting up first one of them stopped turning so I checked and made sure set up was properly installed. Everything checked out. Back in business, sure enough the next one stops spinning I too check that one everything was OK.. So both start working...AND guess what now they both stopped spinning... Those wheels are a Gimmick.... Either I received defective bio wheels or this entire thing doesn't work...
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Noisy & expensive to fix
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed with these filters (unfortunately I have 2 Biowheel 350's and 1 for Biowheel 200 for a 30 gallon tank). I have a Penguin Biowheel 200 thats been going strong for a year and I love it. I bought the 350's because of my positive experience with that one. Big mistake. Within a month of using the 350's they started making an awful rattling noise. I learned I needed a new impeller in BOTH but the cost of an impeller is only $5 less than the whole freaking filter! Aside from the noise, they don't even do a great job filtering. I will never buy Marineland filters again.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Manios

customer_reviews.title: Dont Buy
customer_reviews.text: Never Worked. Bought 2. Neither worked. Their CD was not helpful but kept me hanging on till I couldnt send it back. But with the 2 I had to pay for plus the 10 extra filters I bought for it so about 100 bucks totally down the drain. My fault i should have paid better attention but with all the extra filters i bought i really really needed one of these pumps to work. Both had same issue, could not get enough suction to power the aquarium water up into the filter area. Just no suction.
customer_reviews.author: Bettybakebake

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, stops working twice a week, wasted my money.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this filter running for only 2 weeks and it has stopped working 4 times already. I wake up in the morning and it's empty and hot and I have to take the intake off and put it back on for it to start back up. My aqueon HOB's worked for years before having any issues. This filter is so disappointing. Going to have to buy a new one. What a waste of money. I even spent extra for an extension and the extra intake strainer smh. Also honestly this is the loudest filter I have ever owned and I have multiple filters running on multiple tanks. Hope this helps someone else.
customer_reviews.author: 💋

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I actually have 2 of these filters. One I've had for 7+ years on a 55 gallon aquarium that has one very large parrot cichlid and it's still just as quiet and works as well as did on day one. The second I just bought as a replacement for a different brand in a 29 gallon aquarium that had gotten really loud over the last couple months and then quit pumping water. My fish are happy and the noise level is almost zero which makes the rest of my family happy, LOL.
customer_reviews.author: MagicWaits

customer_reviews.title: Love it ! ! ! Size is Bang for the buck...
customer_reviews.text: COMPLETELY SATISFIED... Delivered quick as scheduled. No problems with packaging n shipping. Great value. Quality a plus. A must buy. Works as advertised. Highly recommended for others. 😀😀😀SUGGESTIONS for 200 / 350 Models (double slotted): since filter Refills can be pricey at times. But if u have multiple tanks n buy chemical media / filter pad by bulk/roll... best to also purchase the optional empty filter cartridge refill to add u own assorted media. add cutout filter padding using cartridge as stencil. work soooo much better than, last 2x longer heavy buildup, easier to jet clean for multi usage. Gauranteed money saver in the long run over regular disposable filters refills... 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: j0e

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Last
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace same brand and model that was getting noisy after many years of use. I was more than impressed with the performance and durability of it. Thus I went for the same brand and model when replacing it. The new one was perfect, function great and was quiet...that was for the first 30 days. Now just 30 days into use the pump is making a loud growling sound...have gone through all the troubleshooting steps with out any success. Given the success we had with the previous similar unit, I'm not sure if this one was just a lemon, but we're going to look into other options to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Issues
customer_reviews.text: Propeller issues. Only had 2 months now and started making terrible noise. Not sure why it started but know it has something to do with the propeller intake tube spacing. Have 1/2 toothpick in it as a spacer and working well again. Bio wheels weren't spinning properly either prior. One would go and the other would stop. Pull out one filter then both would go. Think that was due to the same issue. The toothpick trick seems to at least temporarily have fixed it. It's the nicest, quietest pump ever without the issue. Would not have expected such problems on 2 months old. And yes, I cleaned it well when the wheels first started giving me a problem.
customer_reviews.author: K. M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Price For A Great Filter System
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my first one on Amazon years ago to help out my main filter. My mature Oscar passed away a year ago and I kept the filters running with no fish. My main filter finally gave out. My Marineland 350 is still going strong. I purchased another one which will be ample filtration for my 75 gallon tank. I stripped out everything. Cleaned out everything. Rinsed out 300lbs of gravel. I will be using a LOT of iive plants this time. So I'm preparing the aquarium with fertilizer, peat, bacteria, etc. I'll be adding the plants next week, then the fish after the aquarium is completely stable. It's a great Winter hobby.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job - it is just loud!!! Lasted five months
customer_reviews.text: I really like this filter as it works great! But I wish it wasn’t so loud! We have the fish tank in our guest bedroom and our friend had trouble sleeping because of the rainforest sounds. I think it is great if you like to sleep to sound machines or if it is in another room you do not sleep in. It does keep it super clean and the fish are happy! The filter lasted about 5 months before it died. We ended up buying another one of the same kind just because it was what we can afford. It is loud but works - until it dies...
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Watson

customer_reviews.title: Good Filter Overall.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I purchased this filter and it is used to replace the same one I purchased over 10 years ago. It is a good value for the money for sure but it is like a printer, they make their money off of the consumables i.e. filter cartridges. Fairly easy to change the filters, but a pain to take it apart to clean out the impeller and water reservoir. It is very reliable and the wheels will last for many many years. I presume it does its job as my tank rarely has any issues related to the filter. I use it on a 45 gal. tall and it is more than adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: This filter keeps my tank clean!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these filters for my 75 gallon aquarium for my two turtles. They are working perfect. There is plenty of room for different media besides the filter pads. I have added bio balls and sponges. The noice level(waterfalls) will Increases as the water evaporates from your tank water level. Keep the water level high for less noice. I add water daily. I like the sound of water falls so it doesn’t bother me. I like hang on the back filters because it’s easy to be able to check them and clean them quickly and easily whenever I need to without dismantling the whole works of the filter. For the price it’s a great filter.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Awesome filter
customer_reviews.text: This filter is Awesome......so much filtration power.....it's actually almost too much for my 29 gal tank but if I keep the water filled up my fish are fine with it....if I let the water go down then there is too much water turbulence for my fish. But amazing filtration power and so easy to clean and change the filters. Its a lot better than what came with my 29 gal tank.....that was proving too little filtration. Plus I love the bio wheels.....I can clean the filter part and not worry about destroying my good bacteria since the bio wheels have the good bacteria on them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Filtration
customer_reviews.text: This is doing an excellent job on my 55 gallon axolotl tank. It really collects the debris from the water and the bio wheels help with nitrate filtering. The filter isn’t loud but the water flowing back into my aquarium is. Some people attached a ramp made out of a pop bottle, for the water to flow down into the tank. I don’t mind the sound of a waterfall in my room. My only complaint is the blue fiber on the replaceable filters starts separating from itself, coming apart, stretching but it’s still filtering. Other brands don’t have the issue with the blue fiber getting stringy, but they also don’t filter as well as this does.
customer_reviews.author: Rowan

customer_reviews.title: Ummm
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was be a more powerful filter, because of how big it is. The water was cloudy within 2 days (even with water conditioner) and it’s so NOISY. Jeesh! It’s in my bedroom and every time I’m on the phone someone asks “Are you peeing?” The performance is okay for the most part, but for a turtle tank I should’ve gotten 4 cartridges instead of just using the 2 provided. Once I try that out I’ll update this review. Update: Big difference when using the 4 cartridges. Water stayed clear for longer and it seems to filter better!
customer_reviews.author: Goddess

customer_reviews.title: Broke after three months
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. One still mostly works, although it randomly stops and I have to jiggle the suction tube to get it working again. Sometimes I need to put it out slightly and other times, push it in a bit more. Annoying but I paired it with a sponge filter so it’s not critical if it quits while I’m at work. The other one. Bought it in July. It totally crapped out and died by early October. The motor doesn’t move at all when plugged in. No vibration or noise. Just nothing. It’s too late to return it and I’m pretty bummed.
customer_reviews.author: BioGeekMom

customer_reviews.title: Great value, clear tank, but noisy
customer_reviews.text: I used this a add-on to a canister filter, and it cleared up the tank within hours, which I just wanted it a backup. The only issues with this is that it's very noisy and you have to keep the water level very high. I wish I could pay a bit more for something that's quieter and allows the water level to be a bit lower. But it's still a keeper for less than 30 dollars
customer_reviews.author: Steven L.

customer_reviews.title: Mess
customer_reviews.text: Awful! Buyer beware! We had this on the back of our 55gal aquarium and it initially worked great. At some point one side of the spinning outlet became clogged. Water continued to pump into the hanging canister and flowing out the back of the pump. I woke up to water EVERYWHERE
customer_reviews.author: Laura R

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Filter
customer_reviews.text: I really like this filter. It does a good job of cleaning the water 💧 on a 50 gallon tank. Easy to clean the floss filters, moves a lot of water. It is a little noisy on the water fall as it rotates the paper perforated filter wheels. Not bad, but it's noticeable. I like this filter so much I bought a second one and put it on the same tank. With two I don't worry about any filter failures. It's very easy to assemble, setup and start. I'm very happy with these filters.
customer_reviews.author: Girl w/No Name

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for the $$$$ spent
customer_reviews.text: Had Aqueon brand hang on back filters before these. They work great but replacement parts are made of unobtanium!!!! Yeah good luck even finding a replacement impeller when yours breaks. There are replacement parts for this filter. Also the replacement filter pads are WAY cheaper then Aqueon! Look it up if you don’t believe me. I like that you have two slots on each side of this filter to add your favorite media if you choose to buy the refillable baskets separate. Great filters with great features. Good value
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Great filtration, creates strong current and is noisy
customer_reviews.text: I am using this on my 55 gallon goldfish tank and it works great, we have to fill the tank to the very top for the splashing not to happen, so the sound of running water is there most of the time but we like the sound. It also creates a fairly strong current which some of our smaller critters have to fight pretty hard.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Garavaglia

customer_reviews.title: Great But missing Bio
customer_reviews.text: Iv'e purchased two previously and they all came with the included accessories. Unfortunately one of the impellers went haywire (got super noisy) and I decided to purchase another filter as they are relatively inexpensive. But the third time I purchased and received the item the Bio wheels where missing. I was going to use the other ones from the preexisting filter I had so there was no problem with that, but what if this was one of my starting filters? I would be out a few Bio wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Vibrating freaking monster!
customer_reviews.text: I actually rated this product pretty high, but, I must tell you, I actually hate it. It's the noisiest filter I've ever owned. I've searched fixes; tried then all. The propeller vibrates. I can not get it to stop. If my children were this noisy, they wouldn't have made it to adulthood. So loud, if I didn't know there were quieter products out there, I'd give up the hobby. I bought two. I'll use them as back up. I can't take it anymore. Please, just let me cope long enough to replace them!
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Broken after only 7wks use
customer_reviews.text: We bought this filter for our sons 40 gallon tank, knowing it was plenty big enough, he installed it the day after Christmas and it has been working great...until today. It’s only been 7wks. It’s making a loud clunking sound as it rotates and we had to take it out because there will no sleeping tonight with the noise it’s making. Not sure what we do now, since Christmas returns deadline was January 31st. Disappointed, sent an email to Marineland and we’ll see if they can help us out.
customer_reviews.author: Eric J.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of the 350s for my African cichlid Mbuna tank. I had good luck w these before. True, the impeller blade costs about 3/4 of this unit. So far I haven’t had issues. These have plenty of room to allow the addition of more media, which is what I did. Bought some floss separately and cut to form. Although these don’t have as much media as what canisters have, the aeration these provide make up for. My cichlids need very oxygenated water and when the water pours out you can see hundreds a of tiny air bubbles as a result.
customer_reviews.author: The Kansas City Wildcat

customer_reviews.title: Quiet but not silenced
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Quieter than I was expecting it to be. If yours is loud try to adjust to the cover on the bio-wheels because it fixed that problem for me. The filter isn't super quiet so if you're someone who can't stand background noise while you're sleeping this may not be the best filter for you but compared to others I've tried in the past this is by far one of the quieter ones. It was a very easy set up and instructions were so simple even a brain dead monkey could've set this up.
customer_reviews.author: sarah Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Best Filter by far
customer_reviews.text: This is able to keep our tank with 4 Convict Cichlids clean! They are the nastiest fish ever and the last filter we had (Tetra) just wasn't cutting it and the tank would be cloudy within days. With this one tho, it's been over 3 weeks since we cleaned and installed it and the water is still clear and no bad smell. Definitely impressed and happy with this purchase. Oh...and the filter cartridges are cheap so that's a big plus
customer_reviews.author: FancyPants

customer_reviews.title: Excellent filter!
customer_reviews.text: These filters are the only filters that I have ever used on both freshwater & saltwater aquariums since they were produced. The filtration is more than adequate and even exceeds the specifications. The entire mechanism is solid and without fail. The only issue that you might experience is when cleaning the inner workings of the intake system. You need to require restraint and gentleness when cleaning those parts that are situated in the motor box. Marine Land is a reputable company with which to work should you experience any problems, even in assembling this item. My only complaint is the extremely high cost of replacement parts.
customer_reviews.author: PROF K

customer_reviews.title: One out of two
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these filters. One works perfectly, quite and no more maintenance then others. The other after 5 weeks, started dumping water out of the tank. we cleaned it and put new filters in it and that didn't help. Lost about 10 gallons in just a minutes or two. Stressed the fish and household out. Wood floor got damaged. but that is the risk of having a tank. So one is a 5 star review, and the other was a one.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Simple basic does the job no fancy piping.  simpler is better.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product's big brother the 400, for a 50 gal tank. But lately the 400 was having problems moving water through the pipes. It was also got noisy. I 've decided to downsize to the 350 and so far it's working just fine, This unit also has dual bio wheels but is much simpler no piping. I look forward to seeing how this unit performs in the future. One thing that I appreciate is that I can get refillable filter packs for the 350 instead of using disposable filter packs
customer_reviews.author: DC3036

customer_reviews.title: Hood light does not fit now
customer_reviews.text: Its not that loud, of course its new and the tank is full. Seems to be working fine. Assembly and installation were painless and quick. Except now I can't use a hood light on whatever side this filter is on. The front cover of the filter hits the switch, making it physically impossible for both items to be installed at the same time. Working on a fix, if anyone has one, please let me know. Tank is 60 gallons, hood light is 22 inches long and 4.5 inches wide.
customer_reviews.author: NoMercy

customer_reviews.title: Quiet!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had another brand of filter this same size for years. Two versions of the same thing and they were both so noisy. I plugged this in and at first I couldn't believe it was working because it didn't have that awful grinding noise of the other brand. But it is working just as well, but with a pleasant burbly fountain sound. I'm a convert to this brand.
customer_reviews.author: EAC

customer_reviews.title: It's ok....I liked my Fluval better.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Fluval for last 8 years n it finally died. I have one senior citizen Oscar still living , so I thought I would try this. My mistake........the bio wheel is a joke. If the wheel is off when made....it doesn't spin freely...it return doesn't provide the biological interaction. Went to local pet store and picked up another. It works, but I added my own bio media in the bottom. I also and not a fan of the filters compared to Fluval thick filters. They are paper thin, with minute carbon in them. Over all despite all my dislikes....it does work.....I just need to learn- don't fray from what works.
customer_reviews.author: Dustan

customer_reviews.title: Look no further. Very powerful and the price is reasonable.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful filter. Exceeded my expectations in terms of functionality. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 🌟 stars is because the cover to the filter does not fit securely. I needed to tape the top two parts of the cover together to get it to stay over the filter. This does not affect functionality though so I'm still very pleased with this unit and would definitely be ordering it again for my other tank.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these exactly two months ago. I have kept them clean and replaced the filters twice. They are both already making horrible noises that you can hear in the next room. Sounds like the impeller on both of them is seizing inside the motor. I've had to unplug one completely because it got so loud I could hear it one room away in my bedroom and it was keeping me awake. Seriously, spend your money elsewhere and don't buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Abrasive

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: You can't get any better value for your money than this. They arent the quietest on the market, but arent nearly as bad as others try to say. I have had 3 of these over the years and they have changed some, but I havent had any of them actually die on me. I would just sell all my aquariums and a couple years later start over again. Spending 3x as much will not get you anywhere near 3x the value as compaerd with these. And as a seasoned aqu arium owner even the high end stuff fails at times so dont pay more just for fancy advertising.
customer_reviews.author: UncleDanDan

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a while but then got really loud, don't use in sand tanks as the impeller wears out quickly.
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for several months but eventually the impeller got louder and louder to the point where it's just obnoxiously loud and I'm ready to throw it out. The impeller costs almost as much as a whole new filter and according to the reviews for the impeller users with sand tanks have to replace them frequently, 1 user mentioned about 3 times per year. At $20 per impeller that adds about $60/year cost to this filter. Might as well buy a good canister filter that's going to last a lot longer and save money.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Awesome filter - can’t beat the price!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome filter and you can’t beat the price! We use it in a 29g (and tossed some carbon in the additional space - little overkill, but whatever) and it keeps the water crystal clear and our parameters have been perfectly stable. The intake adjustment is a bit of a joke, so don’t plan on using this in a smaller tank with fish that don’t do well in stronger currents (Angels, Bettas, etc). We have guppies, a couple cory cats and a pleco and they do great with this.
customer_reviews.author: Hudgens Family

customer_reviews.title: Cleans tank great clear water easy setup easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Ckeans tank great water sound a little loud not for bedroom living room unless you like water sounds i do. The bio wheels never stop for me as others say. My reading are perfect . i wont use anything but marineland bio filters. My water is always crystal clear. Love this filter. I am sure you will too. Have 6 of these filters .Four of them are 6 years old now. Never a single problem . easy to set up easy to clean. You wont be sorry .
customer_reviews.author: Jerry  Badalamento

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk. Have 2 of these filtering my 75 gallon African Cichlid tank. With in a month they are both making loud grinding noises to the point where I unhooked them. Tried cleaning out 3 times and the filter is still screeching and grinding. Would not recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Lasted Five Months, Second One Only One Month.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in September of 2019. Worked very well until this afternoon (February 2020). The pump has stopped working and water no longer flows through it. It was never ran while dry and all instructions were followed. Disappointed. Update: I bought another one of these after the first died. This one only lasted a month before dying. My advice is to buy a different brand and pay a little more.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great filter!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third filter over probably 15 years span. I have an outdoor aquarium so it has to filter a lot of pollen and debris with it being under a tree also. Filter kinds aquarium very clean. This is a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: UNK

customer_reviews.title: Great Filter
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good filter. I have purchased this filter several times through Amazon Warehouse and each time the product has gotten worse. This last time the filter was dirty and covered with algae. All of the parts, except the main filter piece were missing. I was unable to use the filter with so many missing parts so I just threw it away. What a waste of money. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dogmother

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I tend to over-filtrate, especially when it comes to African Cichlids. These filters work great in their own if you have a regular bioload for a 75 gallon. It’s always better to over filter than not enough. I have two of these + a Marineland c 360 canister+ 2 xl sponge filters. I have always used the 350 bio wheel filters . Good quality
customer_reviews.author: BranBear

customer_reviews.title: very silent
customer_reviews.text: Arrived 1 day earlier than expected. I opened the packages and they were very easy to assemble. Put them in the tank, put tank water in them and plugged them. It took 1 minute and they were working perfectly and very silent. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: HERBERT CORREA

customer_reviews.title: Price Drop =  Quality Drop
customer_reviews.text: The Bio Wheels will not rotate at all. They are overall much inferior to the Bio Wheels I have in other Marineland filters which have been performing well for up to eight years. Tried to contact them without success.. The best they could do if they responded is to replace the Bio Wheels with the same poor quality/non working product. Will move on to other manufacturers for filters in the future. RETURNED
customer_reviews.author: viterh

customer_reviews.title: always liked this filter
customer_reviews.text: ALways liked this filter even though the roller wheels do not always work. there is plenty of room to install foam in the back and the filter is thinner and wider than the only cometition which is the aquaclear. also the replacement rollers are 17 bucks and a brand new one is $30 so the price cannot be beaten. I have a couple and one of them is over 20 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Okie 58

customer_reviews.title: Works good, low noise, some minor issues
customer_reviews.text: Relative quiet. Works ok so far. Cons: tube not long to extend near bottom tube is retangle, not round, I will have a hard time extend it down further or far away to have bettwr circulation. Even fill the plastic containers up, it still makes lot of noise before it manage to get water flow. The width of the filter is too big,give me a bit of clearance issue, since I have a middle bracing band on the top. Still like it alot
customer_reviews.author: T. Don

customer_reviews.title: Cleared up my 55 gal turtle tank fast and it was looking bad.
customer_reviews.text: Product showed up fast, Thank you for that. The product was quick to set up and started up perfect, Don't forget to prime b4 you plug it in. I have only had it running now for 3 hours but I will come back and update at a later date but for now all is great. I think this item is priced right as well. Thanks again.
customer_reviews.author: gutterbanger

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I was having a hard time keeping my 55 gallon tanks water clear, I did multiple water changes and still saw no results. Finally I reliazed that I was using the wrong filtration system for this large tank. After I bought this filter I saw immediate results within a day! So glad I choose this filter it uses all three of the chemical bio and mechanical my large tank needs! I am so happy I will by another one to go on the left side of my tank!
customer_reviews.author: Moe Virgo

customer_reviews.title: Good little filter
customer_reviews.text: Great filter for the price. At the pet store it's much more pricey. Wouldn't spend the money there. It's very easy to remove and disassemble the entire filter to fully clean it. Says rated up to 75 gallon tank... I assume some tanks this is ok, but my tanks are well stocked and 55 gallon. I wouldn't use this for a larger tank unless it had a lot less fish in it.
customer_reviews.author: Heather M Ackman

customer_reviews.title: My Acquarium water is Crystal clear
customer_reviews.text: I have a 55 gal tank with 4 fancy goldfish. I used to have 2 Aqueon Quietflow 70 filter and when one of them stopped working in less than 6 months, I bought the Marineland to try and compare. All I can say is that Marineland is definitely quieter and my acquarium water is crystal clear. It is even cleaner when I only use the Marineland by itself. Now my husband wants to get rid of the other working Aqueon and just buy another Marineland filter.
customer_reviews.author: Denny

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I use this for a 50 Gallon turtle tank. Turtles are notoriously very messy kids and this thing works like a charm. I used to own a used one I picked up at the GW, but it finally kicked the bucket and I could not figure out why (I think the motor burned out; granted, I had the used filter for yyyearss). I liked it so much I decided to replace it with the same one (but brand spanking new). The motor itself is quiet, it is just the waterfall that is noisy (one negative). I have the replaceable filters on subscription to remind me to change them monthly. Easy Peasy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too LOUD!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Won’t buy these again due to the noise from the impeller. You clean these regularly and they constantly make noise. The impeller costs more than half of a new one and if you can find these on sale it’s cheaper to replace the entire unit. They do keep my tank clean but I’ll be switching to and different brand soon. I run two on a 55 gallon cichlids tank, clean every month and swap filters every two weeks. Great but horribly noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Working So Far
customer_reviews.text: This filter is priced very well, and it is working fine so far -- good water flow. The only downside so far is that the motor does make a noise (grating sound), something which is common when the pump starts to fail. This pump/filter is less expensive than the one I purchased previously, so I am willing to put up with the motor sound, which to be fair is barely audible over the water flow (at least for now).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This has saved our fish tank!
customer_reviews.text: We had a really dirty 50 gallon fish tank in our school library. After a good clean and makeover, the water was murky from the leftover debris on the tank accessories. I purchased these filter cartridges (along with the filter), and the water was crystal clear the very next day! I then dreaded the upkeep of it as I have no prior personal fish aquarium experience, but the tank has been clean for at least 3 months. I'm VERY happy with this filter and will continue to order the cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Nmpollard

customer_reviews.title: Awesome reviews and I got a lemon maybe...too noisy and leaked
customer_reviews.text: I’ve read a bunch of great reviews so I thought I’d buy it. It seemed like a good filter except it was kinda loud. I haven’t used hang on the.back filters in about 15 yrs but this thing was loud. Mine leaked but I’m sure others aren’t defective. Maybe I got a lemon.. the other thing is they only give one charcoal filter for each side so you need to buy the rest of the filters
customer_reviews.author: Master U

customer_reviews.title: HOB Sump
customer_reviews.text: I'm using 2 in my 70 gallon cichlid tan. I'm using 1 with filter floss and sponge and the other is set up with bio balls and ceramic rings. Plenty of room to add whatever you want. So far I haven't any issues with the wheels. Also the option to pull water from the middle and bottom of the pick up tube is a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Michael from Birmingham

customer_reviews.title: After Many Months Review
customer_reviews.text: Been using for months, almost a year now. Keeps my ranchu Laguna Rectangular Tub 60 Gallons clear. But of course, I have the filtration super increased. 1.) Micron Polishing Filter Pad - most important in small debris pickup 2.) Marineland Refillable Cartridge - Reusable and saves money, also keeps beneficial bacteria to keep pond safe
customer_reviews.author: Just Some Asian Swordsman

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Works so well! And a great price for a very nice filter. Make sure you read the description and dimensions because this thing is big! Maybe a bit big for my aquarium but still great. Quiet and nice quality.
customer_reviews.author: Shak

customer_reviews.title: Great filter for both saltwater and freshwater!
customer_reviews.text: I use the marineland 350, seaclone skimmer and aqua clear 70 for 75G reef. I threw out the cartridge that comes with it and use the refillable cartridge that marineland sells separate. I fill it up with Seachem matrix. I use the refillable cartridge with matrix, I use 3 layers of poly fil roll not fluff, and I cut a sponge. I do it for both sides of the 350. Do no use the filter cartridge they sell it clogs up. This works great and I have no ammonia, nitrite, and nitrate. It’s a budget filter that does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: No noise and tanks clear.
customer_reviews.text: Was leery to buy this on amazon but was worth it. The price was cheaper than the pet stores and it's an easy set up. Tank is crystal clear and the unit doesn't make any noises.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Great pump for the tank!
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well and I would definitely buy another one of the same brand if I ever had the need. I purchased it back in 2007 and it was still filtering away in 2010 when I took apart the fish tank.
customer_reviews.author: Mermalade

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made product
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Marineland Penguin Power Filter in the last 12 months, they do not last and Marineland does not stand by the warranty. Stay away from Marinelane products if you are looking for something that will last over a year.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wolbransky

customer_reviews.title: This filter is nicely affordable off of Amazon
customer_reviews.text: This filter is nicely affordable off of Amazon. I have to replace it every year, year and a half, but at this price I am okay with that. Especially when compared to Petco, which is the only pet shop near my home. Last time I was there and looked, they were selling this same filter for $70. Huge price difference. It cleans well and I have to do very little maintenance on my tank. Just swap out the filters when I notice a bit more algae growth and I am good to go. I have this filter on a 40 gallon breeder tank.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Howard

customer_reviews.title: Missing items
customer_reviews.text: I received the main part of the filter system but it didn't come with the piece that runs down into the tank. It also didn't have the blue filters, which description said it had. Luckily, I had both items since my old 1 quit working & I didn't want to send it back since I really needed it. However, I'm not happy it didn't come with items that SHOULD have come with it. Filter at least works so I have to say I'm at least happy with that.
customer_reviews.author: Right Hand

customer_reviews.title: Good water volume, but somewhat loud
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat noisier than I'd like, but not a huge problem. I like the volume of water it moves, and have used much of the space inside the filter area for additional media to increase biological filtration. I also recently added a foam prefilter on the end of the intake. These are probably not recommended by the manufacturer, but it's working well for me. I still maintain a pair of the Rite-Size C cartridges as additional prefilter to keep too much junk from hitting the bio media.
customer_reviews.author: TryingSolar

customer_reviews.title: I see why this filter is Amazon's "#1 Best Seller!"
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my aquarium from 29-gal to 50-gal. So I upgraded the filter to this one. I have only used it for one month, and I am happily surprised that the water is still clear in the tank. It is a little noisy but not to where I can't hear my tv or hear it down the hallway. In fact, I'm so used to the running of the water through the filters that it is rather soothing, like white noise. I see why this filter is Amazon's "#1 Best Seller!"
customer_reviews.author: Martha E.

customer_reviews.title: Been using these for years, and they've always delivered.
customer_reviews.text: The whole Biowheel idea is great--it does work! And on top of that you get the mechanical filtration in the back. The filter's well priced and the (proprietary) filter cartridges are reasonably low cost as well. That's why I've been using these for years. I'm enjoying this latest iteration and all its improvements.
customer_reviews.author: someoneSomewhere

customer_reviews.title: Short life span and bad design
customer_reviews.text: I've owned fish tanks most my life and have been through several different filter brands, but this has been the worst. It died on me after about a year-and-a-half. I've been able to take apart and put back together in most cases other filters to repair them but this one not the case. I contacted the products customer service and was told I need to expect to buy parts to repair it on average once a year which cost almost as much as the product itself. This is very disappointing as it did work well before it died. I cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Love love this and at a great price! Much better than we expected.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing value! I was greatly surprised when we unboxed this. It is a great find at an even better price. My grand daughter needed a filter for a large 125 gallon tank so I got this one to do until I could get a better one. But when we got it in, we were both surprised. Easy setup and It’s doimg a great job. Strong flow of water filtered hour after hour. I don’t think there will be a need to upgrade later. It’s great.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy S.

customer_reviews.title: Best filter yet.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 55 gallon tank with two large and fancy goldfish. These are seriously messy fish. This was super easy to set up and should be just as easy to maintain. I ordered this from Amazon as it was the only place I found it for sale. It is what the aquarium center uses on their tanks. Cleared my tank in an hour, is quiet and doesn't work as an evaporator like all my other filters did. I add or remove water on my schedule. Great vendor. Prompt delivery. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: ETet

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I purchased this with Petco because I needed one ASAP, then I decided to look on Amazon, found the same exact one for half the price! So I bought another one lol Now I have 2 and my tank has never looked so good! Highly recommend! And shop through Amazon instead of in store, half the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Mandy shoats

customer_reviews.title: LOUD and You can't quiet it.
customer_reviews.text: The loudest filter I own. I have this on a 45 gallon tank in my bedroom and I've had to get up and shut it off so I could sleep! I'm looking for another filter now , this one filters okay as long as You don't have to be in the same room with it. I've replaced the impeller (which cost as much from the manufacturer as this whole filter does from most places) to no avail. DO NOT purchase if You want a quiet filter.
customer_reviews.author: T L S

customer_reviews.title: Breaks after a while but good for a cheap filter
customer_reviews.text: These filters are not one of my personal favorite but if ur in need for something cheap this will do the job. Some downsides are that It dosent have as much media capacity as a canister filter or aqua clear but it is cheap. I also find the filters to be a bit noisy even when new and they eventually get more noisy until they end up breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: A Beast! And Cheap!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. Extremely powerful and quiet. No swishing noises gets me like others have stated. Do yourself a favor- buy 4 of the Marineland 350 Refillable Cartridges. But some Renew or Carbon in two and put mechanical media in the other two.(filter can handle 4) this will save you so much money compared to always having to buy the C cartridges!
customer_reviews.author: GreysFerryGhost

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my African chiclid tank. I am running 2 fluval FX series and wanted something to hang on the back the tank to help with water flow. So far it works very well and is quieter than what I thought it would be. The bio wheels are working correctly and I hope this will put last the one I had from Walmart that would always stop.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: Great at cleaning careful with placing it back in if not put in correctly it will be loud
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these running for my goldfish tank,update 2/6/2020 not even a year in and I've gotten it replaced once already and now it's been making an awful sound...I have done everything to make it silent...vaseline/reinserting it in ,checked for anything that would bother it ect ...nothing though, I just give up on it cheap yes but overall last is barely a year good luck who ever purchases this
customer_reviews.author: Luz Rebolledo

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I bought two of these for my Oscar grow out tank and both work great, especially with my messy monster. One bio wheel stops spinning occasionally but other than that, they work great. I did put some extra bio media in them though. Considering they are over $50 a piece at my local petco, it was a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No worries about crashing your tank by filter change.  Two filter slots mean that you can put 1 filter and one anything
customer_reviews.text: Double slots (for two filters mean that you can put 1 filter and one anything. I have a bag of Purigen on one side and a sponge one the other. No worries about crashing your tank by changed the filter. Oh stop grumbling about tumbling, so I have to upend the bag every water change. Water test say phos is out.
customer_reviews.author: C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Never worked more than two days in a row
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 50-gallon turtle aquarium to replace an older filter system. This never really worked correctly. The first problem is that it is somewhat flimsy and my turtle kept knocking the intake tube off (that probably wouldn't happen with fish, though!). Secondly, every few days the suction would quit and the impeller would have stopped turning. I would take everything apart, clean, jiggle stuff and then get it going again. Over and over and over. I finally gave up. I would not recommend this filter and I am very disappointed that I did not let Amazon know sooner so maybe I could have gotten a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie P. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great unit for an even greater price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price I paid this is a big upgrade when it comes to sounds. My Aqua Clear 70 was beginning to sounds pretty rough, and in the living room where we watch TV it’s not ideal. Picked this up for around 25$ and couldn’t be happier so far. Not to excited by just having the C filters, as my Aquaclear had a piece of foam, the carbon, and the bio max. This doesn’t have the foam, but I don’t expect much difference, in regards to how clean my tank stays. Will update with any changes.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Marineland 350 filter
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 55g aquarium at one of the local pet shops here in Hawaii for $80 BUCKS! Needed 2 and I wasn’t going to spend $160! But I did want to support this mom and pops pet shop so I bought the 1st one from them and the next one on amazon for $35 BUCKS Filter works like a charm, it’s quiet, not silent, but it works for me. Overall happy with this filter and seller.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger

customer_reviews.title: THE LOUDEST THING I HATE IT SO MUCH
customer_reviews.text: The water falling noise form this filter wakes me up from a dead sleep it is the LOUDEST thing. Such a shame because it cleans my tank so well but it’s the biggest waste of money because i can hear the water falling no matter how full my tank is when i open my front door i wish i was lying. Trying to return it ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this filter!
customer_reviews.text: Great filter, if the biowheels stop spinning just make sure your floss or replacement filters are placed correctly. I shoved mine down too much once, caused the wheels to stop spinning. Make sure everything is in the proper place, facing the correct way, and it works great! Clean water, happy fish!
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Moves the water
customer_reviews.text: My tank has a brace support in the middle top ---and the unit was almost an impossible fit. However I got it in with no clearance. Love the unit it really moves the water and is quiet by my standards. By the way my fish seem more than happy according to their movement. Great price and unit is as avertised!!!!
customer_reviews.author: jacob M. Smith Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Is working great!
customer_reviews.text: This water pump works perfectly for my large fish tank. It has 4 different filters but is surprisingly quiet. My tank was pretty dirty before I installed this pump and in only a few hours it has cleared up tremendously. It has a good amount of suction and filters a decent amount of water.
customer_reviews.author: Tab Romine

customer_reviews.title: BROKEN AFTER 40DAYS OF USE!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brand because I thought I could trust them for being reliable but after only 40 DAYS OF USE it broke on me, this is either a fake knock off I got or the machine was used/broken before I got it because my other ones I purchased almost a year ago are still working strong...
customer_reviews.author: Danny K

customer_reviews.title: Soooo loud!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a VERY powerful filter. Kept my tank clean. But it pulls too much water, making a mess on the plastic wrap protecting my light bar on the top of the tank. (I’m looking for lids now lol) not to mention the waterfall was extremely loud, no matter how full my aquarium was, to the point that volume on my 50” TV would have to be at 60% in order to hear anything. It would also keep me awake at night. By far the loudest waterfall filter I’ve had yet, and the messiest.
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Extremely super disappointed in these
customer_reviews.text: Extremely super disappointed in these, very sorry i bought them, trust me these are loud, very loud, and for the size you cant add anything like purigen to the media compartment, and as for the bio wheels they don't worth crap, all they do is produce thousands of micro bubbles and make your aquarium look like it has little particles floating about, would never recommend them, already removed them and replaced them with 2 Seachem Tidal 75s, will see how they work out, but o my GOD they are quiet, if you don't see the water moving you would think they are not running.
customer_reviews.author: EdwinW

customer_reviews.title: Not the best investment
customer_reviews.text: Only had this for a week and one of the rollers is slready not working. You can see from the video that the other roller is clearly operating.
customer_reviews.author: Don't stop writing

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable pump
customer_reviews.text: This is the third filter that I buy of this model. All three filters worked great at first but then about a week or two later they all started making the same weird noise inside the motor part. They were pretty clean still but I still cleaned it out completely and the noise did not stop I sent the other two back but this one has past the return date so I guess I am screwed out of a pump
customer_reviews.author: Mike Ockhertz

customer_reviews.title: Use this filter!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my stock aquarium filter to this unit..... THIS WAS A GREAT CHOICE... priming was extremely easy. The original was a PITA! I HAD IT UP AND RUNNING IN 10 MINUTES.... There is another slot to add a 2nd filter/charcoal filter pack. Save your fish. This is the one to buy!
customer_reviews.author: CRAIG ANDERSON

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I love it but it definitely is noisy. Has my tank looking crystal clear and my fishies are enjoying it! Very affordable. I have a 55 gallon tank and it is 15 years old still in great shape
customer_reviews.author: MissMarie

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 of these in November and all 3 have quit working already. 2 right out of the box made loud noises and had to get new propellers for them. 2 have died in recent months and now I had only 1 left and game home to a smell of something. Took me a awhile to figure it out and it was the 3rd one of these. The motor had quit turning the propeller and was just on heating up and the water at the propeller was almost 113 degrees and my tank is kept around 82 degrees. Glad I figured it out and came home when I did.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and efficient
customer_reviews.text: Our 55 gallon fish tank was looking pretty murky. The fish tanks are my husband's project, but I had to step in and get a more efficient filter. This filter is quiet and seems to pump well. It has cleared up the tank nicely. Prior to this filter we had 2 smaller ones. I guess in this instance one larger filter is significantly better than 2 smaller ones that equal the same size.
customer_reviews.author: mom of five

customer_reviews.title: Extra space to customize filter media
customer_reviews.text: Filter world's great no issues and I like that there is extra room inside the filter for extra filter media, that allows me to customize them to my liking.
customer_reviews.author: GDavidson

customer_reviews.title: Clean, quiet and efficient!
customer_reviews.text: Our new baby red eared slider required alot of new products to make him/her the safe and happy lil one that he/she is today! With how dirty turtles are i decided to spend a lil extra to get a more heavy duty, harder working filter. This dual filter has been working GREAT! To fit in my short tank i had to remove the long tube and just put the lil do hicky on. Haha. It works so good. Easy to install and maintain. Our turtle loves clinging onto the lil basket do hicky thing that the water goes in thru. That is where u find him/her most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: A bit louder than others, but it's worth it
customer_reviews.text: As my title says, it's a little louder than other filters I've tried, but it's better than any other too. The extra noise seems to come from the cylinders that form the biological part of the filter, so if your aquarium doesn't need that, you may want to look elsewhere. Pro's: Works well Multi-stage Easy to put together/take apart Easy to clean Versatile (Don't necessarily have to use the proper cartridges) Cons: Noise: It's abit louder than others Size: It's bigger than I thought it would be Lose fitment: My turtle keeps managing to knock the intake pipe off
customer_reviews.author: Mantis64

customer_reviews.title: Good buy, strong filter.
customer_reviews.text: The noise is like falling water from a small pond waterfall . I feel like it’s a very soothing sound but it is a “ noise” for all the ppl who don’t want any from their filter. Other than that this Is a strong filter. I almost forget that I have to change the water every month because the tank just doesn’t get dirty. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Bell Jr.

product_meta.title: MarineLand Penguin 350 BIO-Wheel Power Filter
product_meta.description:
Size:50-75 Gallon, 350 GPHFor more than 40 years, Marineland has been committed to fishkeeping success. By applying biological science, advanced engineering and imagination to fishkeeping, Marineland continues to be the leader in innovative aquatic environments & equipment. Today, that spirit of innovation is alive and well at Marineland. Whatever your passion — fresh or saltwater, big or small — count on Marineland to bring you the most reliable, the most technically advanced, the highest quality aquariums and accessories on the market. All Penguin BIO-Wheel Power Filters deliver easy, three-stage mechanical, chemical and biological aquarium filtration. Convenient Penguin Rite-Size Filter Cartridges come ready to use with each filter...ready to mechanically and chemically remove waste, discoloration and odors. Each contains new faster-acting Black Diamond Premium Activated Carbon for maximum efficiency. Biological filtration is provided by the revolutionary and patented BIO-Wheel - proven best at removing toxic ammonia and nitrite. All BIO-Wheel filters feature Noise-Reducing Two-Piece Vented Covers, and Adjustable Mid-Level Intake Strainers.

AMAZON.COM


PENGUIN POWER FILTERS: EASY AND EFFECTIVE FILTRATION
Penguin BIO-Wheel Power Filters deliver effective, easy, 3-stage aquarium filtration—without the hassle of air pumps, valves, and tubing or air stones. Convenient Rite-Size Filter Cartridges come ready to use with each filter . to mechanically and chemically remove waste, discoloration, and odors. Biological filtration is provided by the revolutionary BIO-Wheel—proven best at removing toxic ammonia and nitrite.

ADDITIONAL FEATURES
Two-Piece Vented Cover: Designed for convenient filter cartridge access and quiet operation

Adjustable Mid-Level Intake: Attaches to the intake tube for improved water circulation

3-STAGE FILTRATION
Stage 1: Mechanical Filtration

At this stage, the Penguin Rite-Size Filter Cartridge floss screens out dirt and debris and utilizes a patented ribbed back for maximum water to carbon contact.

Stage 2: Chemical Filtration

Black Diamond Premium Activated carbon works to remove odors, discoloration, and impurities.

Stage 3: Biological Filtration

The patented BIO-Wheel eliminates toxic ammonia and nitrite on contact and is designed to grow the beneficial bacteria needed for biological filtration. The BIO-Wheel now features 50% more surface area.

PICK THE RIGHT FILTER FOR YOUR SIZE AQUARIUM
Certified Flow Rate Aquarium Size Penguin 100 100 GPH Up to 20 gallons Penguin 150 150 GPH Up to 30 gallons Penguin 200 200 GPH Up to 50 gallons Penguin 350 350 GPH Up to 70 gallons START-UP AND MAINTENANCE
The Penguin Power Filter requires virtually no set-up, making it perfect for any fish lover. Simply follow the manual in connecting the parts and then hang the filter onto the back of your tank. Be sure to prime your filter with aquarium water before you plug it in. Once you have set-up your filter you can adjust the water flow by using the mid-level strainer. After the initial set- up maintenance of this filter is quite easy. Simply remove and replace the filter cartridge after approximately one month and clean the filter as needed. It is also important to maintain an adequate water level in your tank to insure your Penguin Power filter runs quietly and efficiently.

FIND THE RITE-SIZE FILTER FOR YOU
Each Penguin Power Filter comes with one Marineland Rite-Size Filter Cartridge. Take a look below to see which cartridge is correct for your filter and ensure proper maintenance.

Rite-Size A Cartridge Rite-Size B Cartridge Rite-Size C Cartridge Fits Penguin 100 and Mini Power Filters Fits Penguin 125, 150 Power Filters Fits Penguin 170, 200, 330, 350 Power Filters TETRA WATER CARE
Tetra sets the bar high in water care treatment and maintenance with a four-step, color-coded system. From aquarium start-up and routine maintenance, to trouble shooting solutions and testing, Tetra offers everything you need to keep your aquarium water healthy. Take a look at the chart below to see the full line of Tetra water care treatments and testing supplies.

Start-Up New Aquarium? Tetra SafeStart allows you to safely add fish to your tank immediately. Maintenance Use AquaSafe whenever adding water to neutralize chlorine and heavy metals. Use EasyBalance weekly to keep your water chemistry balanced. Solutions High ammonia? Use AmmoniaSafe liquid or tablets. Cloudy water? Clear it up with WaterClarifier Liquid or Tablets. Algae issues? Keep in check with AlgaeControl liquid or No More Algae tablets. Testing Tetra EasyStrips make regular water testing a breeze.
feature_bullets: Focused on the healthy living of your aquatic pets
Quality designed and tested for highest performance
Don't Settle for anything less, use Aquaria Products
age range description: All Life Stages

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
